title: The Mosaic Protest
outcome: The collapse of BCI sparks a wave of leaderless civic assemblies that take over city life. Encouraged by free access to BCI files, residents form neighborhood councils for justice, resource sharing, and reconciliation. Faction leaders attempt to shape outcomes behind the scenes, but the assemblies fiercely debate Halden's legacy and the fate of centralized control. As the city paralyzes itself with deliberation, Council factions must negotiate openly or risk losing all influence.

events.description: Neighborhood assemblies form at mural sites to address justice, resource needs, and historical grievances. Crowds draw from all social ranks.
Council factions openly debate the future of BCI at the main mural. Arguments flare between advocates for algorithmic order and assembly representatives.
Public courts run by citizens address BCI-era injustices. High-profile Council figures are called to testify about their roles in old scoring abuses.
With city services at risk, Council members try to broker a deal with assembly leaders. Talks stall as assemblies demand permanent power sharing.
Stenograd slows nearly to a halt as competing civic assemblies and the Council fail to agree. Rumors of secession and radical reforms circulate citywide.
